0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Nasal congestion: 7.5 mg to 15 mg (5 to 10 mL) ORALLY every 12 hours

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Nasal congestion: (12 yrs and older) 7.5 mg to 15 mg ORALLY every 12 hours
  • Nasal congestion: (6 to 12 yrs) 3.75 mg to 7.5 mg ORALLY every 12 hours
  • Nasal congestion: (2 to 6 yrs) 1.875 mg to 3.75 mg ORALLY every 12 hours

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• breastfeeding mothers
  • hypersensitivity to phenylephrine, any related compounds, or any ingredients
  • newborns

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• asthma, bronchial and other lower respiratory disease
  • bowel obstruction or narrowing
  • cardiovascular disease
  • concomitant MAOI or within 14 days of stopping a MAOI
  • diabetes mellitus
  • hypertension
  • hyperthyroidism
  • increased intraocular pressure
  • prostatic hypertrophy

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Phenylephrine: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Phenylephrine hydrochloride, a synthetic sympathomimetic agent, is a powerful post-synaptic alpha-receptor agonist with minimal effect on the beta-receptors of the heart. It exhibits a rapid and moderately extended vasoconstrictor and mydriatic action. Its action in the heart includes elevation of the heart rate and reduction of cardiac output.

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Patient should not take phenylephrine tannate during or within 14 days following MAO inhibitor use.
  • This drug may cause nonulcer dyspepsia, giddiness, headache, insomnia, nervousness, or restlessness.
